answerText: apoptosis[10] Cytochrome C binds to a complex that triggers a cascade of these molecules. These proteases specifically target cysteine and aspartate sites in proteins for cleavage during apoptosis.
heading: DEES |2014 | VCU A-Carleton A | 20 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Upon infecting a cell, viruses express Bcl-2 proteins to stop cell death by blocking this process. For  [10] Name this process which may be triggered by BH3-only proteins such as PUMA, eventually leading mitochondria to release cytochrome C and inducing cell death.
